plugins.name: Spacing Token Generator
plugins.description:
üîß What It Does

This Figma plugin helps you automatically generate spacing Tokens based on your preferred scale. Whether you're working with a base-4 or base-8 spacing system‚Äîor even a custom multiplier‚Äîthis tool creates a clean, structured set of spacing tokens to integrate into your design system.



‚öôÔ∏è How It Works


1. Choose Your Base Grid

Start by selecting your preferred spacing grid:

- 4pt scale (perfect for tighter systems)

- 8pt scale (industry standard for scalable design systems)

- Or choose the "Custom" option to set your own base multiplier (e.g., 5, 10, etc.)


2. Add Multipliers

Define the multipliers you want to generate tokens for.

You can:

- Use the default multipliers (e.g., 1x, 2x, 3x...)

- Add your own custom multipliers for more control over your spacing structure.



3. Generate Spacing Tokens

Click "Generate" and the plugin will automatically:

- Create a new variable collection called "Spacing"

- Generate a full set of iTokens (Figma variables) based on your chosen base and multipliers

- Structure them cleanly and consistently for immediate use across your components


üöÄ Why Use It?

- ‚úÖ Save time on repetitive token creation

- ‚úÖ Maintain consistency across your design system

- ‚úÖ Scale your UI spacing logic with precision

- ‚úÖ Easily integrate into Design Tokens pipelines or handoff processes
plugins.tagline: Generate spacing Tokens instantly, right inside Figma.

plugins.name: Name by Layers
plugins.description: This tool provides a convenient way to rename frames, groups, components, or instances based on the names of their nested elements. It allows you to select one or multiple containers and apply a desired naming convention. The plugin will then automatically rename the selected containers using the names of their child elements.

plugins.name: Figma to Imgur
plugins.description:
Figma to Imgur is a simple plugin that instantly converts any resource from Figma into an Imgur link. One click, and your design is ready to share, present, or save.


‚ú® Features:

  1. Export more different resource at a time ‚Äî no extra steps
  2. Imgur links are generated instantly
  3. Great for quick sharing, feedback, or posting online


üîÆ How to Start

  1. Select your resources ‚Äî you can pick up to 10 objects at once
  2. Click "Export Selected" ‚Äî let the plugin do its magic
  3. Done! Your Imgur links are ready to use
plugins.tagline: Export your design to Imgur

plugins.name: Frame Inspector
plugins.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.

accepted.name: Jorge Steban Talaga Soto
accepted.description:
üëã Hello, I'm Jorge Steban!
I'm a UI designer with 3 years of expertise in creating intuitive and visually appealing user experiences.

plugins.tagline: Streamline frame organization in Figma with automatic device and width labeling.

60156.name: Frame Inspector
60156.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.
60156.tagline: Streamline frame organization in Figma with automatic device and width labeling.

plugins.name: Theme Mode Converter
plugins.description:
The Theme Mode Converter plugin makes it easy to switch your Figma designs between light and dark themes. Whether you're working on a new design system or updating an existing one, this plugin saves you time by automatically converting your design elements between light and dark modes.


Key Features:

  1. Convert selected elements between light and dark themes
  2. Works with nested components and complex designs
  3. Flexible folder structure support (light/.../... or color/light/... etc.)
  4. Clear notifications about conversion results
  5. Preserves your design structure while updating colors


How to Use:

  1. Select the elements you want to convert
  2. Choose either "Convert to Dark Theme" or "Convert to Light Theme" from the plugins menu
  3. The plugin will automatically convert all matching variables
  4. Check the notifications for conversion results


Requirements:

  1. Your design should have matching light and dark mode variables
  2. Variables should follow a consistent naming structure (e.g., light/primary vs dark/primary)


Tips:

  1. Use the plugin early in your design process to ensure consistent theming
  2. Combine with Figma's variable collections for maximum efficiency
  3. Test your designs in both modes to ensure accessibility
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly switch between light and dark themes in your Figma designs with just one click!

122718.name: Theme Mode Converter
122718.description:
The Theme Mode Converter plugin makes it easy to switch your Figma designs between light and dark themes. Whether you're working on a new design system or updating an existing one, this plugin saves you time by automatically converting your design elements between light and dark modes.


Key Features:

  1. Convert selected elements between light and dark themes
  2. Works with nested components and complex designs
  3. Flexible folder structure support (light/.../... or color/light/... etc.)
  4. Clear notifications about conversion results
  5. Preserves your design structure while updating colors


How to Use:

  1. Select the elements you want to convert
  2. Choose either "Convert to Dark Theme" or "Convert to Light Theme" from the plugins menu
  3. The plugin will automatically convert all matching variables
  4. Check the notifications for conversion results


Requirements:

  1. Your design should have matching light and dark mode variables
  2. Variables should follow a consistent naming structure (e.g., light/primary vs dark/primary)


Tips:

  1. Use the plugin early in your design process to ensure consistent theming
  2. Combine with Figma's variable collections for maximum efficiency
  3. Test your designs in both modes to ensure accessibility
122718.release_notes: Updated for compatibility with the latest Figma API, including support for async variable operations and improved error handling.
122718.tagline: Effortlessly switch between light and dark themes in your Figma designs with just one click!

plugins.name: Knak - Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Turn Figma Designs into Production-Ready HTML‚ÄîIn Seconds


The Knak - Figma Plugin helps Marketing Designers bring their Figma designs into Knak and turn them into fully editable emails‚Äîwithout having to start from scratch. Instead of manually rebuilding designs, you can import them directly into Knak, refine the details, and create reusable modules and themes that fit into your workflows.


With this plugin, you can:

‚úÖ Speed up Design-to-Production Workflow

‚úÖ Transform Figma designs into Knak HTML in seconds‚Äîno manual handoffs, no back-and-forth.

‚úÖ Keep Designers in Figma

‚úÖ Let designers stay in the tool they love while keeping every email on-brand. Push designs to Knak with one click, ensuring a smooth handoff that preserves brand guidelines and creative integrity.

‚úÖ Make it easier for Marketing Operations to review and finalize designs.


How it works


1 - Design in Figma

  1. Create email layouts using the Knak - Figma Plugin.

2 - Sync to Knak

  1. Push designs directly into Knak‚Äôs no-code builder with a single click.

3 - Refine & Launch

  1. Fine-tune, personalize, and translate in Knak, then send directly to your marketing automation platform.


Read the step-by-step guide here.


Need help? Visit our help centre.

accepted.name: Knak
accepted.description: Knak is a no-code campaign creation platform, enabling users to design, collaborate, and deploy emails & landing pages with ease.

plugins.tagline: Move your Figma designs into Knak and get emails across the finish line, fast.

plugins.name: CSS Color Extrator
plugins.description:
CSS Color Extractor

CSS Color Extractor es una herramienta intuitiva que te permite extraer todos los colores CSS utilizados en cualquier sitio web con solo ingresar la URL. Simplifica el proceso de recoger y reutilizar colores de otros sitios para tus proyectos, ya sea que necesites inspiraci√≥n de una paleta ya existente o simplemente quieras analizar los tonos usados en una p√°gina.


Caracter√≠sticas Principales:

  1. Extracci√≥n R√°pida desde una URL: Introduce la URL de cualquier sitio web y extrae todos los colores CSS utilizados, incluyendo variables declaradas en en el root.
  2. Copiado Manual: Tambi√©n puedes pegar manualmente las declaraciones CSS del inspector de tu navegador para obtener los colores.
  3. Identificaci√≥n y Copiado F√°cil: Copia los valores hexadecimales o las variables CSS con un solo clic.
  4. Interfaz Amigable: Dise√±ada con una interfaz limpia y amigable que hace que la experiencia sea intuitiva y eficiente.
  5. Ideal para Dise√±adores y Desarrolladores: Si buscas una forma r√°pida de identificar paletas de colores en la web, CSS Color Extractor es perfecto para ayudarte a ahorrar tiempo.


¬øC√≥mo usarlo?

  1. Ingresa la URL de la p√°gina web de la cual deseas extraer los colores, o copia y pega las declaraciones CSS.
  2. Presiona el bot√≥n "EXTRAER COLORES" y obt√©n todos los colores utilizados.
  3. Selecciona cualquier color para ver su c√≥digo hex o nombre de variable CSS, y c√≥pialo f√°cilmente al portapapeles.
plugins.tagline: Extrae la paleta de colores de un sitio web

plugins.name: Smart Reparent
plugins.description:
Use this plugin to insert nodes into an auto-layout frame as absolute-positioned children while preserving their existing position on canvas.


To use:

  1. Select the base frame and the nodes you wish to insert. Make sure the base frame is ordered behind the frames you wish to insert.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Profit!
plugins.tagline: Reparent nodes into auto-layout frames while preserving position.

49115.name: Smart Reparent
49115.description:

To use:

  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Profit!
49115.tagline: Reparent nodes into auto-layout frames while preserving position.

plugins.name: Logo Light
plugins.description:
Transform Color Logos to Clean White Versions


Logo Light is a powerful Figma plugin that quickly converts any color logo or image into a clean, professional white version with transparent background‚Äîperfect for dark backgrounds, presentations, and mockups.


Key Features

‚ú® Instant Transformation - Convert any color logo to white with a single click

üñºÔ∏è Supports All Image Formats - Works with JPEG, PNG, SVG, and any other image format in Figma

üì§ PNG Output - Creates clean PNG files with transparency for maximum flexibility

üéõÔ∏è Advanced Controls - Fine-tune the result with contrast and threshold adjustments

üîç Preview - See your white logo in real-time against a dark background

üéØ Multiple Modes - Choose from three conversion methods for perfect results:


Luminance - Best for detailed logos with gradients

Silhouette - Ideal for solid logos and simple shapes

Threshold - Perfect for high-contrast conversion with clean edges


Why You Need This Plugin

Designers frequently need white logo versions for dark mode interfaces, mockups, and presentations. Instead of manually tracing or recreating logos, Logo Light automates this process with precise results in seconds. It works with any image format, including JPEG files that typically don't support transparency, and outputs clean PNGs with transparent backgrounds.

How to Use


Select any image or logo in your Figma document (JPEG, PNG, SVG, etc.)

Click "Generate Logo" in the plugin

Adjust settings to perfect the result

Click "Create in Figma" to add the white version to your document


The generated white logo maintains the exact proportions of your original and is placed right next to it for easy access.

Perfect For


Creating dark mode versions of websites and apps

Converting JPEGs and other non-transparent formats to clean white PNGs

Designing presentation templates with consistent branding

Building mockups with white logo variations

Preparing press kits with logo alternatives

Maintaining brand asset libraries with all logo variants


Feedback and Support

We're constantly improving Logo Light based on user feedback. If you have suggestions, encounter any issues, or need assistance, please reach out to us via our support email or website.

Transform your logos in seconds with Logo Light ‚Äî the essential tool for every designer's toolkit!
plugins.tagline: Transform color logos to white with a single click

Building mockups with white logo variations

Preparing press kits with logo alternatives

Maintaining brand asset libraries with all logo variants


Feedback and Support

We're constantly improving Logo Light based on user feedback. If you have suggestions, encounter any issues, or need assistance, please reach out to us via our support email or website.

Transform your logos in seconds with Logo Light ‚Äî the essential tool for every designer's toolkit!

plugins.name: Variables ‚Üí Text Styles
plugins.description:
Easily Apply Variables to Your Text Styles

Tired of manually assigning variables to text styles? Variables to Text Styles plugin lets you streamline this process by syncing your variables to existing text styles.


How It Works

You'll need existing text styles and typography variables ready to go, then follow these steps:


  1. Create text objects
  2. Apply variables to the text layers' properties
  3. Name the text layers to match their corresponding text style. If your styles are in folders, include the full path using '/' (e.g., folder/subfolder/style)
  4. Run the plugin
  5. Select your text layers. If you make changes, you'll need to reselect them.
  6. Click "Update Text Styles" to apply the variables


Important Notes

  1. If you modify your text properties while the plugin is open, reselect them to refresh the updates.
  2. This plugin does not convert text layers into styles, allowing you to continue making adjustments.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Sync variables with your text styles.

plugins.name: Onyx ‚óÜ Design System to Code
plugins.description:
Onyx ‚óÜ Design System to Code


‚óÜ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



‚óÜ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



‚óÜ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



‚óÜ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Components & Design Tokens ‚Üí Vue & UnoCSS

86524.name: Onyx ‚óÜ Design System to Code
86524.description:
Onyx ‚óÜ Design System to Code


‚óÜ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.

‚óÜ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



‚óÜ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



‚óÜ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.

plugins.name: Mock Data Generator
plugins.description:
Mock Data Generator is a Figma plugin designed to enhance the design process within Figma by allowing designers to insert realistic mock text data directly into their designs. 


This plugin provides a wide range of data categories and types that can enable you to visualize how your design elements will appear when populated with actual data. 


By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
plugins.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

100786.description:

How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
100786.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Spagett!
plugins.description:
Spagett is here to spook you! Get ready to see Spagett everywhere.

When executing the plugin there's two possible scenarios:

1. Some layers is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every selected layer.
2. No layer is selected: Spagett will be added as a fill to every layer that already has a fill in the page.

(Some context https://youtu.be/uyh3C1xDT3Y)

The code for this plugin is open sourced at GitHub

plugins.name: RealSize Plugin
plugins.description:
RealScale is a Figma plugin that allows designers to view their designs at real-world size directly on the canvas. It automatically scales the viewport based on the PPI (pixels per inch) of your display, giving you an accurate representation of how your designs will appear on real devices. Simply install the plugin, select a layer and run the plugin.


How to use:

  1. Select a layer
  2. Activate the RealScale plugin.
  3. Enter the display details (resolution and screen size).
  4. Enter the target display details.
  5. Enjoy viewing your design in true-to-life dimensions!


Note: No subscription required.

accepted.name: Fail Fast
accepted.description: Digital experience design studio with +90 creatives. Embracing fearless innovation, we ideate, prototype, test, and learn without fear of failing.

plugins.tagline: Scale your designs to real size instantly.

plugins.name: Figaro Design System Token
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.
plugins.tagline: Export Collection Variables

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.

plugins.name: Jargonator
plugins.description:
Ditch lorem ipsum forever! Jargonator uses AI to generate realistic copy to fit your designs and give it a much more accurate and professional feel. This plugin is integrated with ChatGPT and allows you to precisely control the amount of text generated, including the tone and content. Add detailed direction to the model to fine-tune your text via the settings panel. This AI-powered plugin is so quick and easy at creating realistic text, there‚Äôs no excuse to use lorem ipsum ever again!


Currently this plugin is provided for free by Savas Labs and you are not required to enter your own API key. Once the API costs exceed a certain threshold you may be required to enter your own OpenAI API key in order to continue using this plugin

plugins.name: Warp Zone
plugins.description: This plugin creates a 'Warp Zone' page in your document where you can store Figma objects you want to keep but don't need right now. Just select any frames, components, or other elements and run the plugin to warp them away. Each object remembers where it came from, so you can easily send them back to their original pages later by selecting them in the Warp Zone and running the plugin again.
plugins.tagline: Store and recall objects quickly and easily.

129345.name: Warp Zone
129345.description: This plugin creates a 'Warp Zone' page in your document where you can store Figma objects you want to keep but don't need right now. Just select any frames, components, or other elements and run the plugin to warp them away. Each object remembers where it came from, so you can easily send them back to their original pages later by selecting them in the Warp Zone and running the plugin again.
129345.tagline: Store and recall objects quickly and easily.

plugins.name: Rastarizer
plugins.description:
Rastarizer simplifies your workflow by converting Figma frames, components, and instances into optimized raster images. Simply add "-x" to the name of any frame, component, or instance you want to include in the conversion. Your originals remain intact and are only hidden during the process - easily restored with a single click. Perfect for preparing slides for PDF export or creating static versions of your designs.


Features include:

  1. One-click conversion of frames, components, and instances to images
  2. Adjustable resolution (1x to 3x)
  3. Automatic size optimization
  4. Easy toggle between original and rasterized versions
  5. Progress tracking for batch processing
  6. Non-destructive workflow (originals preserved)


Disclaimer: This plugin is provided "as is" without any warranties. The developer is not responsible for any issues that may arise from its use. Users are advised to maintain backups of their work.
plugins.tagline: Convert frames, components, and instances to high-quality raster images with a single click

plugins.name: 8pt Grid Align
plugins.description:
8pt Grid Align eliminates the tedious task of aligning designs to an 8-point grid. A simple, no-fuss solution to amplify your design workflow.

  1. Instantly snap objects and round object measurements to the 8pt grid with one click.
  2. Scale proportionally, while keeping stroke weights intact.
  3. Quickly apply preset container sizes and grid widths for common screen sizes.
  4. Use the lock ratio option for precise resizing and scaling.


If aligning to 8-point grid divisions feels like a chore, this plugin will save you time and make your layouts cleaner and more consistent.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly align and scale your designs to the 8-point grid with precision and ease.

115389.name: 8pt Grid Align
115389.description:

  3. Quickly apply preset container sizes and grid widths for common screen sizes.
  4. Use the lock ratio option for precise resizing and scaling.


If aligning to 8-point grid divisions feels like a chore, this plugin will save you time and make your layouts cleaner and more consistent.

plugins.name: Character Count
plugins.description:
Select any text layer , run the plugin and get the character count in a sec!


Two available options

  1. Character Count
  2. Count and annotate, the plugin will insert a quick annotation to your Figma Canvas.


This plugin is part of a series of plugins with pure focus on elevating little things we designers need! and a form of giving back to the design community -xOxO

accepted.name: Mina Awadallah
accepted.description: A designer with a simple purpose!

plugins.tagline: Get that count in a sec!

plugins.name: Select Related
plugins.description:
Rather than selecting "siblings" this plugin allows you to select "cousins".


This is useful when wanting to modify related items in deeply-nested hierarchies.
plugins.tagline: Select or step through distantly-related items in complex component trees

54322.name: Select Related
54322.description:
Rather than selecting "siblings" this plugin allows you to select "cousins".


This is useful when wanting to modify related items in deeply-nested hierarchies.
54322.release_notes: Change matching leaf nodes from **index** to **name**
54322.tagline: Select or step through distantly-related items in complex component trees

plugins.name: Gridify
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for Figma that allows you to quickly and easily generate the three most common viewports and grids for each device, perfect for any design project you start from scratch.


Functionality:

‚Ä¢Creates viewports for the 3 main viewports, adding grid styles to each frame.

‚Ä¢Mobile (4 columns, type: stretch, margin: 24, gutter: 20)

‚Ä¢Tablet (8 columns, type: stretch, margin: 32, gutter: 30)

‚Ä¢Desktop (12 columns, type: center, width: 65, gutter: 30)


Contact and support:

If you have any questions, suggestions, or improvements, chat with me:

jcrocco@mindtrust.com
plugins.tagline: Create main viewports for web design

plugins.name: Responsive variables
plugins.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the plugin‚Äôs local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select ‚ÄúReset Storage Data.‚Äù
plugins.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

128424.name: Responsive variables
128424.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the plugin‚Äôs local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select ‚ÄúReset Storage Data.‚Äù
128424.release_notes:
* Added an option to rename variables
* Introduced the ability to assign a spacing variable to a specific scope (applies only to new variables).
* Various bug fixes and improvements
128424.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

plugins.name: pixelbrush
plugins.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
plugins.tagline: Create and manipulate pixel art

112648.name: pixelbrush
112648.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
112648.release_notes: - Added color selection button and functionality

plugins.name: Sunsetter
plugins.description:
Sunsetter is useful for deprecating components before publishing the next version of your design system.


  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

accepted.name: Amogh Srivastava
accepted.description: I love creating things that makes making other things faster

plugins.tagline: Deprecate components in a click

125046.description:

  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs
125046.release_notes:
- Added dark mode support
- Add option to hide from publishing (adds underscore before name)
- Added option to create a deprecation notes
- Added option to not turn off using red overlay
